page.title: 12Horticulture:Heather Nursery
page.content: Achahoish Heather Nursery is situated in Achahoish at the junction of the private road to Ellary. The nursery is run by the owner/manager who has at time of writing (June 1985) 6 adults and 2 girls under his direction (all living locally). There are 75 varieties of heather grown. Stock plants are kept, and approx. 100 cuttings are taken and potted from each stock plant. The heathers are potted in equal quantities of peat and grit and are housed in plastic tunnels. There are approx. 25,000 heathers in each tunnel and there are 18 tunnels on the site ,watered from a central pumped water supply. The heathers are sold to the trade at 20p each, though they can be bought in local shops at approx. 70p each.
